page.title: 01GENERAL DESCRIPTION
page.content:
THIS BLOCK COVERS THE HIGH FELL AREA OF BLACK COMBE AND PART OF THE LOW - LYING AREA OF THE WHICHAM VALLEY.
BLACK COMBE IS 600 METRES OR 1970 FEET ABOVE SEA LEVEL AND IS THE SOUTHERNMOST OF THE HIGHER LAKELAND FELLS.THE SUMMIT IS AT THE END OF A LONG WHALEBACK RIDGE OF HIGH MOORLAND STRETCHING DOWN FROM ESKDALE IN THE NORTH. THE EASTERN SLOPES FALL INTO THE DUDDON VALLEY WHILE THE WESTERN SLOPES FALL TO THE COASTAL PLAIN OF THE IRISH SEA.
THE WHICHAM VALLEY IS A SECTION OF FARMLAND BETWEEN BLACK COMBE AND THE RIDGE OF PINE PLANTATION AND ROUGH GRAZING NORTH OF THE TOWN OF MILLOM.
